title: Pak Zaireen group lays traditional Chaddar at Hazrat Khwaja Chishtiâ€™s (RA) Dargah
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 07 (APP): Pakistani Zaireen accompanied by Second Secretary, Pakistan High Commission New Delhi Tariq Masroof on Tuesday placed the traditional Chaddar at the Shrine of Hazrat Khwaja Syed Moinuddin Hasan Chishti (RA) at Ajmer Sharif, India.
A group of 89 Pakistani Zaireen is in Ajmeer Sharif from 7-9 January to participate in the 813th annual Urs mubarak of Hazrat Khwaja Syed Moinuddin Hasan Chishti (RA), Pakistan High Commission, said in a press release.
After placing the traditional chaddar on behalf of the people and Government of Pakistan, the delegation offered prayers for the progress and prosperity of Pakistan.
Earlier, upon arrival at the Dargah, the delegation was welcomed by prominent members of the Anjuman Moinia Fakhria Chishtia Khuddam Khwaja Sahib.
Pakistani Zaireen attend the annual Urs Mubarak of Hazrat Khwaja Syed Moinuddin Hasan Chishti (RA) under the framework of 1974 India-Pakistan protocol on visits to religious shrines, it was further added.
